unnormalised: When do Indians celebrate Diwali? Well, Diwali, the festival of lights, doesn't have a fixed Gregorian date. Its occurrence is based on the Hindu lunar calendar, specifically the month of Kartik. That's why Diwali can fall anywhere between late Oct and mid Nov. This yr, 2024, it’s expected on Oct 31st.

unnormalised: The festivities usually span 5 days, starting with Dhanteras, 2 days before the main Diwali day. Then there’s Naraka Chaturdashi (Choti Diwali) on the day before. The main day of Diwali, when Lakshmi Puja is performed, typically falls on the new moon night, or Amavasya. Finally, there's Govardhan Puja and Bhai Dooj to wrap up the celebrations. So plan your holidays accordingly from 29/10/24 to 02/11/24!

unnormalised: Other major festivals also move around. For instance, Holi, the festival of colors, is observed in March, but the exact date varies yr to yr. It generally falls on the day after the full moon (Purnima) in the month of Phalgun. Similarly, Eid-ul-Fitr and Eid-ul-Adha follow the Islamic lunar calendar, so their Gregorian dates shift each year. Understanding these lunar calendars is essential to keep track of the exact dates.
